base.extract_clean_profile: Whether to run the pipeline module to obtain a profile from a clean image of the source
base.process_rave_fit: Whether to run the pipeline module to process/save a profile from an existing rave fit
base.run_frank: Whether to run the pipeline module to perform a (1D or 1+1D) frank fit
base.run_parametric: Whether to run the pipeline module to perform a parametric fit to a nonparametric brightness profile
base.aspect_ratio_fig: Whether to generate a figure showing frank vertical inference results
base.compare_models_fig: Whether to generate figures comparing the clean, rave, frank brightness and visibility profiles, and images
base.root_dir: Root directory used to load data and save results. Should contain subdirectories of the form <disk name> that have further subdirectories 'clean', 'rave', 'frank'

clean.robust: Robust weighting parameter value for clean and rave analysis, results processing
clean.rmax: Maximum radius for clean image profile extraction [arcsec]
clean.Nr: Number of radial bins for clean image profile extraction
clean.Nphi: Number of azimuthal bins for clean image profile extraction

frank.rout: Maximum disc radius in the fit (best to overestimate size of source) [arcsec]
frank.N: Number of collocation points used in the fit (suggested range 100 - 300)
frank.alpha: Order parameter for the power spectrum's inverse Gamma prior (suggested range 1.00 - 1.50). If a list, multiple fits will be performed
frank.wsmooth: Strength of smoothing applied to the power spectrum (suggested range 10^-4 - 10^-1). If a list, multiple fits will be performed
frank.method: The fit method: 'Normal' to fit in linear brighness, 'LogNormal' to fit in logarithmic brightness
frank.I_scale: Minimum brightness allowed for radial profile for frank fit. Should be lower than data noise floor
frank.set_fstar: Source for visibility amplitude to be treated as unresolved stellar emission (a constant subtracted from all real visibility amplitudes). One of ['MCMC', 'SED', 'custom'], which are set per source in the source parameters .json (by default, `default_source_pars.json`)
frank.scale_heights: List of `start`, `stop`, `num` for `np.logspace` call to define scale-height grid over which to run fits. E.g., `[-2.5, -1, 10]` corresponds to `np.logspace(-2.5, -1, 10)`. If seeking to run a standard (non-vertical) frank fit, set to null
frank.nthreads: Number of CPU threads on which to run multiple fits (note a single frank fit is fastest on only 1 thread)
frank.save_profile_fit: Whether to save fitted brightness profile
frank.save_vis_fit: Whether to save fitted visibility distribution
frank.save_uvtables: Whether to save fitted and residual UV tables (these are reprojected)
frank.make_quick_fig: Whether to make two figures showing basic results of the fit

parametric.form: A list of parametric functional forms to fit to a nonparametric profile. One or more of ['asym_gauss', 'triple_gauss', 'double_powerlaw', 'double_powerlaw_erf', 'double_powerlaw_gauss', 'double_powerlaw_double_gauss', 'single_erf_powerlaw', 'double_erf_powerlaw'] (see 'parametric_forms.py').
parametric.device: The backend device on which to run the parametric fitter using JAX. Can be null, 'cpu', 'gpu', 'tpu', or one of `jax.devices()`. If null, JAX will use a GPU or TPU if available, else fall back to the CPU.
parametric.learn_rate: Learning rate for the parametric fit optimization
parametric.niter: Number of iterations for the parametric fit optimization

plot.bin_widths: Widths in which to bin the observed visibilities for plotting. List of float [\lambda]
